result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark Rabago was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight time if imposed.
Concurrent with: 16CM51 and 14CT1584
*Court would permit early termination of probation after 18 months with recommendation of agent.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.  DNA Sample/Surcharge waived based on date of violation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new law violations.

No contact with:  Any Boston Store in Milwaukee area.  Not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Maintain full-time employment and/or school combination.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  
16CM195 and 16CT1071 are dismissed and read in. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To be performed as a condition of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Rabago

Notice of Case Status Change. Terminated - regular

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Attorney Mark Emil Kershek in court.   Defendant Mark Rabago did not appear.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attorney appears by authorization.   Attorney Kershek requests the Court set the matter for plea and sentencing in 60 days.  The Courts schedules 14CT1584 for jury trial and thus case to tag along.  Hearing scheduled for September 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Hearing scheduled for October 11, 2016 at 08:15 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
Defendant to pay: $50.00 per month commencing 8/1/16.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Mark Rabago in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.The Defendant advises the Court that he does not qualify for represenation by the public defender's office and requests the Court appoint an attorney.  The Defendant is sworn in and the Court finds the Defendant is eligible and will appoint an attorney and will order repayment in the amount of $50.00 per month commencing 8/1/16.  Attorney Kershek is in court and accepts the appointment and will represent the Defendant.  The Court amends the bond to a $500.00 signature bond with the same conditions as previously set.  Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Hearing scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Mark Rabago in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario as friend of the court.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.Defendant allowed 1 free phone call to obtain bail.

  Hearing scheduled for June 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
Defendant Mark Rabago in court.  Kristi Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The District Attorney's Office to summons the Defendant to Court.
